body.p:
Septr the 1st 1863
To His Excellency
Thomas E. Bramlette Governor of Kentucky

Your petitioner George A Bowyer would respectfully represent that he is a loyal citizen of the county of Fayette where he has resided for 25 years last past. That at the July term of the Fayatte county court he procurred a license and paid tax on same in the Court aforesaid to peddle merchandise in the County of Lincoln his object being to supply the officers of the Federal army with clothing, he procurred his clothing and went to the county of Lincoln aforesaid but failed to have his license countersigned as the law directs by the Clerk of the Lincoln County court; whereupon he was arrested tried be before His Honor W. G. Bailey Judge of the Lincoln County Court and fined one hundred dollars, which amount he deposited with the Judge aforesaid to be held by him until the decision of your Excellency in this matter. Now your petitioner states that he had paid the taxes due to the state of Kentucky upon his license before he arrived in the county of Lincoln with his goods, and did not defraud the state out of one cent of her dues; nor did he intend to do so, having paid for his license before leaving the city of Lexington

He thefore prays your Excellency to m remit that portion of said fine which would otherwise vest in the Commonwealth believing the same
would be just between the state of Kentucky and petitioner

Respectfully your
Obedient servant
George A Bowyer

I certify that I am the prosecuting Attorney for said County and was present and prosecuted Said Geo. A. Bowyeir before the Judge of Lincoln County court. The statements made by him in the above Petition are substantailly true. and I think this a case which merrits your clemency.Sept 1st 1863

The undersigned George of the Lincoln County Court proceeded in the trial of the Petitioner and know that the facts stated in the Petition are true and that in the opinion of the undersigned his cause is one meriting Executive clemency & I ask for him the same 1st September 1863

Respectfully &c
G Barrey J L C C

If the within stated fine is remitted his Excellency Governor Bramlette will forward the same to me at Stanford & I will draw the money & forward to the Petitioner
I am atto for Bowyer

Sept 5th 1863
Remit all except costs &C
Tho E Bramlette

Lincoln County Ct.
$100
George A Bowyer
Remitted 5th Sept 1863
